sen.j: しのびねは、平安時代末期に成立しその後散逸した王朝物語、ないしは南北朝時代 (日本)に成立した前者の改作本をいう。
sen.e: The Tale of Shinobine is a courtly romance which was completed at the end of the Heian period and was subsequently lost. It also refers to a revised version of the story produced during the period of the Southern and Northern Courts (in Japan).

The Tale of Shinobine is a courtly romance which was completed at the end of the Heian period and was subsequently lost. It is an adaptation of a story produced during the period of Southern and Northern Courts (in Japan).
sen.cmt: "refers to a revised version"→"is an adaptation"; eliminated "also" as it felt unecessary
sen.e: The Tale of Shinobine refers to a courtly romance which was completed at the end of the Heian period and was subsequently lost, or to an adaptation of a story produced during the period of Southern and Northern Courts (Japan).
sen.cmt: refers to として、一文にしました。

sen.j: 典型的な悲恋遁世譚とされる。
sen.e: It is apparently a typical tragic love story where the hero becomes a monk and the heroine either dies or makes her way at court.
It is a typical tragic love story where the hero becomes a monk and the heroine either dies or makes her way into the court.
It is a typical tragic love story where the hero becomes a monk and the heroine either dies or makes her way into the court.

sen.j: 「しのびね」は悲恋に「しのび泣く」姫君を表すと考えられている。
sen.e: 'Shinobine' is taken to represent the heroin 'silently weeping' for her painful love.
The title, "Shinobine," represents the heroin "silently weeping" from her painful love.
sen.cmt: added commas; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The title, 'Shinobine,' represents the heroin 'silently weeping' from her painful love.

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 中納言は美貌の姫君と恋に落ちる。
sen.e: The Chunagon (Middle Counsellor) falls in love with a beautiful princess.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Chunagon (Middle Counsellor) falls in love with a beautiful princess.
The Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) falls in love with a beautiful princess.
sen.cmt: 中納言→Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) としました。

sen.j: だが父に恋を反対された中納言は父の決めた相手と結婚し、姫君と別れる。
sen.e: Met with his father's opposition, he marries the woman whom the father has selected for him and leaves the princess.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Met with his father's opposition, he marries the woman whom the father has selected for him and leaves the princess.
Met with his father's opposition, he marries the woman whom the father has selected for him and leaves the princess.

sen.j: 姫君は母の縁によって宮中の某所に移り住んだが、そうした姿を帝に見いだされる。
sen.e: The princess moves to a certain place within the court through her mother's connection. She is then recognized by the emperor.
With the aid of her mother, the princess moves to a certain place within the imperial court and is recognized by the emperor.
sen.cmt: 宮中: court→imperial court; fixed grammar to read as one sentence
sen.e: With the aid of her mother, the princess moves to a certain place within the imperial court and is recognized by the emperor.

sen.j: それでも姫君は中納言（中将）のことを忘れられなかったが、偶然の機会に中将と姫君は宮中で再開した。
sen.e: This does not make her forget the Chunagon (Chujo) however. The lovers happen to see each other again at the court.
sen.cmt: 「再開」は「再会」と解釈しました。
sen.e: Even so, the princess does not forget about the Chunagon (Chujo), and the lovers meet again coincidentally at the court.
sen.cmt: added "Even so" for ”それでも”; "happen to meet"→"meet again coincidentally"
sen.e: Even so, the princess does not forget about the Chunagon (Chujo), and the lovers meet again coincidentally at the court.

sen.j: しかし姫君は中将を拒否し、中将は出家する。
sen.e: Yet the princess does not accept the Chujo, who then becomes a monk.
The princess, however, rejects the Chujo, who then becomes a monk.
sen.cmt: changed "Yet" to "however"; 拒否する: does not accept→reject
sen.e: The princess, however, rejects the Chujo, who then becomes a monk.

sen.j: 姫君は帝の寵愛を受けて中宮に上りつめる。
sen.e: She finds favor in the eye of the emperor and becomes Chugu (the empress).
The princess find favor in the eye of the emperor and becomes the Chugu (the empress).
The princess find favor in the eye of the emperor and becomes the Chugu (the empress).

sen.j: かつて中将と姫君との間に生まれた子はその後中将と再会する。
sen.e: And the child born between the Chujo and the princess is later reunited with the father.
Thereafter, the child born between the Chujo and the princess is reunited with the father.
sen.cmt: fixed sentence to not start with "And"; fixed grammar
sen.e: Thereafter, the child born between the Chujo and the princess is reunited with the father.
